hints.content:
First, we need to find $3$ cm on the number line.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/3bf15d3629cf866acb6019751008ca23c12b6cc0)

Each dot represents one ribbon. 

So, we need to count all of the dots on the line plot that represent lengths shorter than $3$ cm.  

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/b9d336c38b60f883db17f6144c954091ea6bc784)

There are $\blueE2$ dots that represent lengths shorter than $3$ cm.   

$\blueE2$ ribbons are shorter than $3$ cm.

question.content:
The lengths of ribbons are shown below.  

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/c3422e0293acbadfa8211faf6285aef125dab088)

**How many ribbons are shorter than $3$ centimeters?** 
 
[[â˜ƒ input-number 1]] ribbons
